01/05/2021, 14:40 - +91 94517 58642: 24 HRS Oxygen Helpline starting today 29/04/21
10:00 HRS - 16:00 HRS - 9711170220
16:00 HRS - 04:00 HRS - 9654418883
04:00 HRS - 10:00 HRS - 9873325428
WE ARE NOT SELLING GAS CYLINDERS OR OXYGEN.
We are only helping with real-time information about refilling your cylinder.
Due to the extreme demand for oxygen in Delhi, most of the suppliers are getting numerous calls & they are not approachable over a call anymore.
In order to help people in distress, we have formed a team of volunteers who are stationed at different sites across Delhi / NCR to give us real-time updates of where oxygen stock is available and cylinders are being filled at that point in time. 
So far, we are able to cover 13 sites across NCR
South Delhi -
1. Bhogal:
Arjun Gas, 
352-7/1 Hospital Road, 
Bhogal, Jangpura.
2. Bhogal:
Hukam Chand & Sons, 
Mandir Road, Timber Market, 
Bhogal, Jangpura.
West Delhi -
1. Rajouri Garden:
Gurudwara Nehru Market,
Rajouri Garden.
2. Naraina:
A-16 Naraina Industrial Area, 
Phase 1.
3. Moti Nagar:
WZ -5, Kailash Park, 
Opposite Karla hospital, Moti Nagar.
North Delhi -
1. Ashok Vihar:
Maharaja Agarsen Bhavan.
2. Rani Bagh:
Ram Handloom (Star Property)
Rani Bagh.
Gurugram -
1.Satyam Gases
Sector 33, Gurugram.
2. Hemkunt Foundation
Plot No.809, Sector 42.
Drive-in oxygen support only
3. Manesar:
Star Special Air Gases Private Limited
Plot No. 324, Sector No. 7, Phase No. 2,
I. M. T., Manesar.
Faridabad -
1 Jay Emm Gases:
Plot No. 5-6
Village Mangla Gujran,
 Ballabgarh Sohna Road.
2. Argon Air Gases:
Plot No 113, Galli No 6, Krishna 
Nagar, Sector 25 Faridabad.
3. Hindustan Air Gases
Plot No.64, Sector 25,
Faridabad
These volunteers are stationed there from 10 am to 6 pm and give us updates during these hours in real-time so that we can guide you to the nearest place where you can get Oxygen. 
IF YOU HAVE A RESOURCE TO SPARE YOU CAN ASK THEM TO 
1. Visit the above location yourself and verify availability in advance.
2. Stand or request anyone to stand in cue on your behalf early morning.
OR CONNECT WITH US FOR VERIFIED REAL-TIME UPDATE ON AVAILABILITY. 
We are only able to give information of sites which we have personally Visited, Verified and Established contact so far.
It is advisable that you check for other sources also across Delhi /NCR which are not mentioned in the above list, we are yet to establish connections with many. 
Please call our helpline to get real-time updates. 
Request you to please don't ask questions regarding other services since we don't have access to that information, discussing this will waste time and choke our resources.

02/05/2021, 06:12 - +91 94517 58642: <Media omitted>
02/05/2021, 06:24 - +91 94517 58642: We have set up three units with separate specializations. One looks at updates on oxygen beds, one on icu and third on meds. 
We are not passing lists ( since two nights ago) but calling directly or sending people to the hospital directly to check availability. This has increased efficiency a lot and for the first time between last night and now we have managed to not lose a single contact. In the last week otherwise the team has lost close to 14 people to time. 
  I am writing here some tips from our experience which can be helpful 
A. If you are a volunteer group form specialist groups . Have people on ground. You can cater to less people but see them through.
B. If anyone in your house has a low oxygen reading immediately start looking for oxygen. Chances are high you'll need it for this person or another infected person . Don't wait another 3 to 4 hrs
C . Isolate. Isolate. Isolate. If you have symptoms and rtpcr is negative still isolate
 If more than one person gets it at home getting supplies is exponentially more difficult and you'll have fewer people to cover the house or children. Limit the spread as fast as possible.. 
D. If you are more than 4 people in a house in a high risk area and even one has covid register immediately with your city's covid app. In Delhi, calcutta, bangalore, bombay it's impossible to get a bed at short notice. Don't wait. Register and cancel after three days if not needed.. 
E. Know everyone's blood group at home. 
F. Have at least one post paid phone or prepaid phone with more than 500 rs charge handy at home. 
G. Get a home icu early if you can in case you need ventilator. I will be publishing numbers of some doctors nationally who are trusted and can consult on video. 

H. Finally if you are volunteering, remember unfortunately you can't save everyone. It's just not possible. Work in shifts. Generally there is an hours turn around time on beds in hospitals. That's the only window. If anyone gets it it's ok  . Someone must get it. If it goes more than that someone is outside who could be in care. So try to reduce this time. But don't insist on your family or friends. Right now every life is same, equal. Save whoever you can.  Check who lives closer to hospital. Where can your ambulance reach. How much oxygen is left with whom. Be absolutely clinical about it  . The numbers are huge. Do your best. That's all
And take care. I can't believe we are here but after two weeks I can tell you we are. 
I hope this helps
Please take care everyone

02/05/2021, 15:54 - +91 94517 58642: Finally a Good News : To Counter scarcity of Covid ICU Beds in India (Second Wave ) 
ADGPI - Indian Army  today announced opening up of its all Military hospitals for civilians during Covid. The medical staff of the Army is being made available to various State governments also and the Indian Army is setting up temporary hospitals in various parts of the country. As of 2020, there are 112 Military Hospitals, 12 Air Force Hospitals and 10 Naval Hospitals in India. All citizens can approach their nearest Indian Army hospitals.

*Helpful* - if they're able to help,
*Unresponsive* - if they don't respond,
*Out of stock* - if they don't have stock left,
*Invalid* - if they're not related to your request at all, or
*Remove* - if the number is wrong or the supplier wants to be removed from the database.

03/05/2021, 10:25 - +91 99315 44015: Sad case of people selling Fake Remdesivir!

Case 1: ( Delhi)
7 held for running factory producing fake Remdesivir
They used injections of antibiotic azithromycin as the antiviral drug remdesivir, as the packaging of both drugs are similar. They replaced the labels on the antibiotic vials with fake ones that they printed.
They sold 2000 vials and 3000 were seized 
They were selling one fake Remdesivir vial for around ‚Çπ6,000 to ‚Çπ10,000 to agents, who sold it to needy customers for ‚Çπ25,000 and ‚Çπ40,000. 
Company - "Nectar Herbs and Drugs‚Äù in Kotdwar is sealed

Case2 ( Indore)
5 people arrested.
 They used to get empty Remdesivir vial from the hospitals and fill them with glucose water calling it Remdesivir
Sold at the rate of Rs 20,000. 

Case 3 ( Ahmedabad )
Purchased Max Pharma's Tazocip injection which involves Piperacillin & Tazobactam which is used for Pneumonia & Skin, Gynecological, and Abdominal (stomach area) Infections Caused By Bacteria treatment. Such injection costs Rs. 427.9 per vial. They then remove wrappers and replace with wrappers of Remdesivir of original company.

Case 4 (Mysore)
They refilled cheap antibiotic medicines or saline solution in empty vials of Remdesivir 
Cash amounting to Rs 2.82 lakh seized

PS: You may be buying a fake, if you buy in blackmarket!

*Helpful* - if they're able to help,
*Unresponsive* - if they don't respond,
*Out of stock* - if they don't have stock left,
*Invalid* - if they're not related to your request at all, or
*Remove* - if the number is wrong or the supplier wants to be removed from the database.

07/05/2021, 14:25 - +91 98189 55159: You can get the Plasma from ILBS Vasant Kunj. (Institute of Liver & Billary Sciences ).You have to follow the procedure:-
1. Download " Donors Plasma forms " ( a set of 5 forms) from their website.
2. Get them printed
3. Duly filled by the Pulmonologist
4. Signed & stamped on each sheet too.
5. If you need 2 Plasma units, 2 separate set of forms , shall hv to be filled.
This was requisite one & absolutely mandatory.
6. Now you need to take these completed forms to ILBS. 
7. If you have a donor, get his Antigen test done, here. The report takes 1.5 hours. If the antigen is healthy, & the donor qualifies with a score of 7-10, he can donate a unit. In exchange of which, you get your desired Plasma unit.
8. In case your donor doesn't qualify, is rejected by ILBS,  or you do not have a donor, what do you do?? Simple. Ask for a donor.
9. Many attendants come with 2-3 or 4 donors, just in case, any of their donors fail the antigen test. Here , if their work gets done with one donor, since their requirement is of only a single Plasma unit, the other donors return. They had come to support their patient/ attendant only.
10. Catch hold of these donors. Convince them for donating a single Plasma unit, as that is the mind set they came here with. Get their antigen test done. On qualifying, let them donate their Plasma. In return, you take your unit in an ice box, to the reqd hospital & Pulmonologist. Your patient shall be . Be +ve. All the best!!

08/05/2021, 08:39 - +91 94517 58642: When all of this is done, 
there will be lighter rooms
and heavier hearts, 
the table set, out of habit, 
for those who will no longer come, 
slowly but surely, 
a day will appear, 
ordinary

school buses will ply, 
a gaggle of children spilling out, 
lovers sit conspicuously close 
upon a park bench,
office goers rush about, 
as they do, 
an assumed seriousness, 
for anyone who might be looking,
and crowds throng,
restaurants, bars, the cinema,
as before, 
as before the time 
we no longer speak of

somewhere a doctor 
will close his clinic at five 
and get in a round of golf 
before dinner, 
a funeral service will have a slow day, 
a wily entrepreneur will wonder 
how to put his empty ambulances to use,
a nurse will quietly knit at work 
under her desk

and when we meet those whom we love,
we will linger, 
a little bit longer, 
even laugh, 
at jokes that aren‚Äôt very funny, 
praise indifferent food, 
and forget perhaps, 
old slights that now are 
from before the time,
quietly grateful for touch 

sometimes, unexpectedly
we will meet another‚Äôs eyes 
only for a moment; and know, 
in our shared silence, 
we lived through that time

It would have taken away much, 
our own, 
strangers, a part of ourselves, 
who we were 
from before the time,
but we will know, 
we are here now, and for that day, 
it will be enough.

nandini sen mehra

09/05/2021, 16:14 - +91 96625 26278: It's an update regarding injections - REMDESIVIR and  TOCILIZUMAB. It is not possible to source these in market. Chemist shops are not authorized to sell it. 

It's only available with dealers who are selling it directly to hospitals or selling in black. 

If in need, ask family members / attendant to write an application with complete details of patient, hospital name, consulting doctor, prescription, bed no., Copy of adhaar card and give to CMO of that area. CMO's office will arrange it based on requisition from hospital, patients and availability. And so it  will be on MRP and authentic. 

A lot of fake medicines and injections are also sold in market that too in much higher rate.

10/05/2021, 11:20 - +91 94517 58642: Post Mortem into Rohit Sardanas death. It was due to this :
This is a discussion happening in medical circles. The following is from my brother in law's group who is NHS in UK. Take guard.

Looked relevant so sharing it here!!


*WHO IS KILLING HUNDREDS OF THOSE WHO HAVE JUST DEFEATED COVID. IT'S BLACK FUNGUS*

Dear all,

This is to bring to your information a dangerous disease which is killing people by the hundreds AFTER they have recovered from the dreaded Covid-19 infection.

The disease is *Mucormycosis* and can be fatal. It catches on to those who have been on oxygen support for five days or more. So, the oxygen which gives you life, actually becomes your death sentence. It's that dangerous.

Mucormycosis, simply known as *Black Fungus*, develops in the nasal tract due to poor quality of water used, through which the piped oxygen in hospitals passes to make it hydrated oxygen, before it reaches the patient's nostrils. It's very much like the fungus which develops on bread due to moisture, if kept for a long time.

It starts from the nostril, travels towards the eye and then towards the brain. It paralyses the nerves it travels through. *So, first it‚Äôs the eye that loses vision very swiftly AND permanently! If not stopped, it enters the brain and then it's a matter of a day or two before the person paralyses, has multiple organ failure or sudden heart attack and dies*

For any body on oxygen support in a hospital, it's crucial to keep looking around the nostrils for any black pigmentation. As soon as it's noticed even as the smallest dot, sirens should ring, and anti-fungal vaccination should start immediately because this is the only treatment of the disease. Call an eye surgeon or specialist at once on video call and show him or share a pic.

(The injection dosage is 5 ml per kg weight. So if a person is 60 kg, it should be 300 ml, and if more, upto 80 kg, 400 ml.)

*The oxygen supply also needs to be sanitised immediately. While only distilled water should be used for hydrating oxygen, in all hospitals, due to callosity, negligence or downright ignorance, tap water or any other water available around is used by the para medical staff. What is worse is that the container for this water for hydrating the oxygen is seldom cleaned leading to concentration of viruses and bacteria in the piped supply system, which cures you from Covid temporarily and then kills you with the deadly "Black Fungus". Also, if tap water or even purified / boiled water is used in the humidifier, over a period of time, there'll be deposits of impurities, including micro-metals, minerals / salts which make things worse. Sadly, even many senior doctors tend to overlook this crucial aspect of the life-giving oxygen supply*

Hundreds of people who were on oxygen support and had recently recovered from Covid are dying of this disease everyday. Because, by the time the black pigmentation is noticed by family members at home, it's already too late and even doctors are helpless. The most unfortunate part is the complete lack of awareness about this contamination in oxygen supply and about the deadly disease itself.

I have not seen any discussion or government advisory on any WhatsApp group or anywhere on social media which shows our complete and widespread ignorance about this dangerous "Black Fungus" lurking in the oxygen supply system itself.

*CHECKING FOR BLACK FUNGUS ON PATIENTS ON OXYGEN SUPPORT SHOULD BE MADE AN ESSENTIAL PART OF COVID CONTROL PROTOCOL IMMEDIATELY IF PRECIOUS LIVES SAVED FROM COVID ARE TO BE SAVED FROM THIS DANGEROUS DISEASE*

I myself got to know about this only today, because my childhood schoolmate, my soulmate-brother is lying in KGMU ICU precisely with this ailment, which threatens his life now. Just three days ago, he was taken off oxygen support and his family and all of us, his friends were so happy when he was shifted to the general ward and we were expecting him to go home in a couple of days, some even asking for a party! Today, he's back in ICU fighting for life. May he get well soon. We are all praying for him.

Please spread word about this disease so you won't be in a similar state of despair and helplessness like his family and all of us, his well-wishers, and friends.

I appeal to you with folded hands, please do tell everyone about this, especially those on oxygen support, and if you know any government officials of any rank, please do share this information with them.

You might just save a life

‡§π‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á ‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§§ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ó ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ,‡§â‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§≤‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§î‡§∞ ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§Ü‡§≤‡•ã‡§ö‡§ï ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç ,‡§ê‡§∏‡•á ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡•õ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§¶‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ü‡•ç‡§∏‡§è‡§™ ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§æ ‡§∞‡§π‡•Ä ‡§•‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ç‡§ï‡§ø ‡§á‡§∏ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§∏‡§≤‡§æ‡§π‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ê‡§∏‡•á ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø ‡§µ‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§¶‡§¶‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡§¶‡§Æ‡§æ-‡§ú‡•á‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∏‡§∞‡•á ‡§§‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ï‡•á ‡§∏‡•á ‡§â‡§®‡•ç‡§π‡•á‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡§∞‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡•á ‡§™‡•Ä‡§õ‡•á ‡§® ‡§π‡§ü‡•á‡§Ç‡•§‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ ‡§≠‡§∞ ‡§∏‡•á ‡§ê‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§ñ‡§¨‡§∞‡•á‡§Ç ‡§Ü ‡§∞‡§π‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç, ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•Ä "‡§ë‡§ï‡•ç‡§∏‡•Ä‡§ú‡§® ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•á ‡•õ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§´‡§µ‡§æ‡§π ‡§´‡•à‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡•á ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§è‡§≤‡§æ‡§® ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ, ‡§¨‡§æ‡§µ‡§ú‡•Ç‡§¶ ‡§ñ‡•Å‡§¶ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§§‡§®‡•á ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ú‡§™‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ï -‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∏‡§¶‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§®‡•á ‡§ñ‡•Å‡§≤‡•á ‡§≤‡•á‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ñ‡•á ‡•§ ‡§ú‡§¨‡§ï‡§ø ‡§á‡§∏ ‡§µ‡•ò‡•ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§™‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡§¨ ‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä-‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ï-‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§ú‡•Å‡§ü‡§æ ‡§ï‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∏‡•ç‡§§ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§®‡•á ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§≤‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡§æ ‡§ö‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§Ø‡•á ‡§•‡§æ.‡§ú‡•ã ‡§ï‡§π‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ú‡§∞ ‡§®‡§π‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•á ,‡§ñ‡•à‡§∞.

13/05/2021, 13:58 - +91 94517 58642: Hansraj's Hero Pranjal !

Everytime when we have to find a blood donor near to a hospital located to delhi university, the first name that comes to our mind is of Pranjal. 

He has donated blood/platelets more than 50 times. Yes you read it right 50 TIMES ! or may be even more incase of emergency. Be it midnight, be it weekday or weekend or any time of the day. when we could not find any donor. he was always there for us
Such a kind hearted and generous human being he is !

My team bloodconnect is proud to have many such super heroes who helped us to save a lot of lives 

Now pranjal has relocated to some other place and the demand still remains same.  who is going to step into his shoes now ?

we are not even finding enough people who is willing to go atleast once to a safe place ! 

Imagine if pranjal gave the same excuses you are giving, we would have lost many lives due to blood shortage.

The situation was so critical that even when pranjal asked us for help we were unable to help them all the time. Because we could not find anyone like pranjal when there is a need. 

Just imagine how he would have felt. he came forward 50 times for others but none came forward when he wanted their presence. Do he really deserve this ? why cant we think about saving others lives atleast 4 times in a year or atleast once or twice ?

Please step into their shoes and save lives ! 

Be like Pranjal and Be a Hero !  #DonateBlood

14/05/2021, 00:32 - +91 94517 58642: A huge shoutout to all the volunteers who are spending almost every waking minute of their day for finding leads, coordinating medical resources, hospital beds, bipaps, ventilators, donors and what not. And this for those whom they have never ever met, never will. And to keep doing this amidst their own suffering and losses, trauma. Reaching dead ends yet staying up late in the night till the case gets resolved.  The help is reached.
Common citizens with guts of steel.
The fact of the matter remains, no one should have to do this or rely on Social media to save our souls. But in a failed State, there is nowhere else to go to, but each other.
I don't believe in bestowing labels or laurels as it easily shifts the narrative and attention away from those who are to be blamed, like the government.

In most cases which reach me and I know, medically will be very difficult and there is very little that remains there to salvage and yet seeing the sheer will and determination of this surging sea of human spirit, makes me want to hope against hope and try everything in my own personal capacity, to try till their last breath.
Amidst all this darkness, it is you who breathes in life through your efforts. You all know who you are and I have nothing but admiration, love and utmost respect for you.

#Covid19India

Mandatory
Verification done- She is our friend
Outstation patient- No
Reason for units- Due to covid infection the patient has developed Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation, it's a clotting in blood. Due to clotting the platelet is getting reduced in the blood which in turn causes internal bleeding. So the patient needs to be continuously replenished with blood to maintain the platelet. As the patient has an B-negative blood group which is rare, so it's getting difficult to find matching donors.

16/05/2021, 00:16 - +91 94517 58642: Just realised this volunteering must be very hard on people accustomed to winning. People who are used to tangible, quantifiable results. Who map effort to output in ways that they can put a number against. What most volunteers do is mainly a frenzied race against time, banging their heads against dead ends, have almost sure leads remain almost, chasing leads to the end of the earth only to discover it‚Äôs too late, or the patients‚Äô family has changed their minds, they don‚Äôt need the bed after all. But if you‚Äôre used to things not always going your way, or are aware that there is only so much you can control, which is mainly your own effort, and be okay with losing, many times over, you can still try. One more time, one more case, one more day.

19/05/2021, 20:08 - +91 96625 26278: Some information on prevention and identification of *Black Fungus*

1. Make sure the diabetes levels are monitored post covid, even if the person never had diabetes. Sugar levels increase due to steroids given in covid treatment. So Monitor Diabetes regularly.

2. Nebulizers or oxygen concentrator: Tap water is a big NO, only boiled or distilled water,  Bisleri/RO may be used. Also the tubing should be cleared and everyday.

3. The spores of mucor are present in day to day life, wearing Clean Mask post covid, even at home. Oral hygiene and nasal hygiene is must. Avoid dusty environment.


4. *Look out for any of these signs*:
(a). Pain and redness around the eyes and nose.
(b). Black discharge from the nose.
(c) Acute toothache especially in the upper jaw.
(d). Loosening of teeth.
(e). Pus draining sinuses 
(f). Change in color of the mucosa, black color
(g). Fever
(h). Headache coughing


5. Do not wait. Consult an Ent or a dentist immediately.
IT SPREADS REALLY FAST.

22/05/2021, 14:18 - +91 99315 44015: *Important message on BLACK FUNGUS*. 

Respected Citizen

It is been observed that *mucormycosis* (black fungus) is on the rise in post covid patients. 

Recently two 25-30 age group patient, with history of covid, treated by home isolation and with no history of taking steroid or given oxygen or did not have diabetes also suddenly developed this dreadful disease. 

The question how and where did it come from.

Once you get a viral infection your immunity goes down.

_We have been wearing a mask, it may be N95 or a cotton mask,  which is used multiple times_

*Once we wear it, due to the humidity in our breathing, it gets wet which we dont feel.*

*Then the mask is being used for 3-5 days, a perfect atmosphere for growth of fungus, which we then breathe and goes straight into our respiratory system.*

So all citizens whatever you have been using as a mask,
*Please wash it daily or change it or dry it in pure sun light so no fungus grows on it.* 

This is my personal suggestion and observation.

*Dr Samir Shah*
HOD Surgery
F/D Dr. Tejas Doshi

( Forwarded as received)

22/05/2021, 18:56 - +91 97160 66468: Dear All,

First of all thank you for being with us throughout this tough journey. Many of you were active participant and many were there to seek help. In both the cases you all were of great help.

Having said that, there were many cases where we received anonymous cases and we worked on them too. Meanwhile we started getting suspicious cases where we could not trust the case. 

Few very active organizations are associated with us and working very actively on ground and in the team as well. We got to know that at various places these organization's name is used to make any deal or help us out. In these cases, if you are working on anything first you need to inform the team. This is not ethically right and is disrespectful for the people working really hard on it. 

This disrespect will not be accepted. 

Hope all of you understand and this is really a serious issue. This will not be tolerated any further. 

Thanks for being with us and for your cooperation. üòä

21/06/2021, 10:47 - +91 94517 58642: <Media omitted>
21/06/2021, 16:05 - +91 94517 58642: As per our discussions with NGOs and nodal officer
21/06/2021, 23:24 - +91 94517 58642: After the covid relief, CW Mission Zindagi is set to help the flood affected families in Dist. Bahraich, Uttar Pradesh. 
Baundi Village of Mahsi Tahseel in Bahraich has always been affected by the frequent floods (kataan or erosed soil by water) in the area. People staying there were immensely affected due to the ongoing pandemic, which made things worse for them.
After news of several families getting disrupted due to the heavy floods in many areas of several villages as well as migrant workers not being able to feed their families due to loss of jobs, our team decided to help them out with whatever means possible.
Our team is on ground and closely monitoring the situation in Baundi and nearby areas which are affected by floods . Our team members geared up with the packaging of relief kits. Dry ration like atta, rice, pulses, spices etc. were packed in the form of relief kit and will be distributed in the next couple of days.
We are looking for more support to tackle this yearly flood and Covid Crisis. For any kind of support or information you can reach out our team at

covidwarrior397@gmail.com
